channel.title: announcement on Leipzig Gophers
channel.description: Recent content in announcement on Leipzig Gophers

item.title: Virtual Meetup #12 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! Meetup #12 will take place today, Thurdays, Sep 17, 2020 19:00 CET and will be virtual again. We have a talk about HTTP proxies. You’ll discover one CVE you never heard of and we see what the author of curl says on SO, why curl does not strictly follow the HTTP RFC. UPDATE We accidentally posted the wrong link, here you go. See you!

item.title: Virtual Meetup #11 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! Meetup #11 will take place on Friday, May 15, 2020 19:00 CET and will most likely be virtual again (we will share the zoom link here and on the meetup event page). This time, we’re excited to look at software built with Go. Our main topic will be the cloud native machine learning toolkit: kubeflow. Kubeflow - A follow up Leveraging Kubernetes for Data Science purposes is still a burden for many users these days.

item.title: Virtual Meetup #10 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! The global coronavirus pandemic puts limitations on all aspects of societal life. At the time of our last meetup, two people were infected in Germany, as of this announcement, we are at 57.298 (archived). The Go community addresses resulting issues in a blogpost on the pandemic. For Meetup #10 on Friday, April 17, 2020, we still would like to bring people together, in form of a shorter, virtual meetup.

item.title: Meetup #9 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! Our first 2020 meetup is scheduled for Friday, Feb 21, 2020 19:00 at Basislager Leipzig. We’ll have a 30 min input presentation about Golang’s standard library package net/http, especially extension points and customization options for clients and alternative implementations. UPDATE: There will also be a presentation about Go 1.14 (which will be released next week) and what we already know about Go 1.15 and beyond. Slides and sources can be found here.

item.title: Meetup #8 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! Our next meetup is scheduled for Friday Nov, 15 2019, 19:00 at Basislager. We will have input presentations on two topics: A custom deployment utility for Pull Requests written in Go Go module proxy internals and pitfalls As always, please bring your projects, questions, findings. Spontaneous lightning talks and other inputs are welcome, too. Hallo, 世界! Unser nächstes Meetup findet am 15. November 19:00 im Basislager statt.

item.title: Meetup #7 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! Our next meetup is scheduled for Sep, 27 2019, 19:00 at Basislager. Back after summer break we jump right into a core Go topic: concurrency. We will summarize the book Concurrency in Go: Tools and Techniques for Developers and present and discuss techniques - from theoretical to practical aspects. As always, please bring your projects, questions, findings. Spontaneous lightning talks and other inputs are welcome. too. Hallo, 世界!

item.title: Meetup #6 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! Last minute invitation for meetup #6. This will be an open event - please bring your projects, questions, findings. Lightning talks and other inputs are welcome. too. We have two free tickets for the Golab 2019 Go conference in Florence, Italy - so if you are interested, just drop by. Hallo, 世界! Last Minute Einladung zu Meetup #6. Offenes Treffen, eigene Projekte, Themen, Tools, Fragen sind willkommen, ebenso lightning talks und andere Inputs.

item.title: Meetup #5 invitation
item.description: Hello, 世界! For meetup #5 we will have two lightning talks: Beautiful (and strange) IO A short overview of the io package and its interfaces and possible strategies for custom implementations. Plus some a few examples of implementations you might not have seen before. Controlling a headless browser with Go. A quick look at web automation with Go and Chrome. As always are also looking for lightning talks, presentations or other kinds of inputs.

item.title: Meetup #4 invitation
item.description: Meetup #4 is scheduled for Friday, May 17, 2019, 19:00 CEST at Basislager. Hello, 世界! For meetup #4 we will have a presentation Philipp, about the Lightning Network by especially about a Go middleware that allows to monetize Web APIs on a per-request basis. Without accounts, credit cards, payment providers - in a pure P2P fashion. We will have a short refresher on Bitcoin as well. As always are also looking for lightning talks, presentations or other kinds of inputs.

item.title: Meetup #3 invitation
item.description: Meetup #3 is scheduled for Friday, April 12, 2019, 19:00 CEST at Basislager. We will take a closer look at Go modules for dependency management. We also have one potential proposal for a lightning talk with the cryptic title “Ramen Linux”. As always, please bring your own code, projects, ideas, Go and Cloud-Native questions and let’s discuss them. See you there.

item.title: Second meetup invitation
item.description: For our second meetup tonight, we have two lighting talk proposals: Turn data into Go struct - how to easily work with complex XML documents and JSON data with Go Glance at the io package and some io.Reader implementation, that you may not have seen before - how to implement your own reader and some examples of useful (sometimes strange) implementations from existing projects Please bring your own code, projects, ideas, Go and Cloud-Native questions and let’s discuss them.

item.title: First meetup invitation
item.description: First event announced. Hello, 世界! This is our first meetup, for anybody interested in the Go programming language and Cloud-Native technologies. We would like to know, what you would expect from the meetup, what you would be interested in and talk about the roadmap for the next months. For this first event, we do not have a special topic, so it’s more a come together to get to know and connect the community.

item.title: New Golang and Cloud-Native Meetup
item.description: We now have an meetup.com profile, upcoming events will be announced there. Thrilled to see people expressing interest in this.

item.title: First meetup date is fixed
item.description: The first Golang and Cloud-Native Meetup will take place on Friday, 8th of February 2019 starting 19:00 at Basislager Leipzig, ground floor. Are you using Go? Are you curious about Go? Are you a cloud architect? You are working on an interesting project that you would like to share? Or maybe you just want to meet some fellow Gophers in your city? Then, by all means, consider dropping by. This will be our first meeting and there will be plenty of room to participate and shape this meetup going forward.
